skill.name: brenda-database
skill.description: Access BRENDA enzyme database via SOAP API. Retrieve kinetic parameters (Km, kcat), reaction equations, organism data, and substrate-specific enzyme information for biochemical research and metabolic pathway analysis.
skill.summary: Access BRENDA enzyme database via SOAP API. Retrieve kinetic parameters (Km, kcat), reaction equatio...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: The skill includes Python scripts that call a BRENDA client to retrieve data from an external API and write results to local files. No evidence of credential harvesting, persistence, or obfuscation was found, but network access and file writes require user awareness.

medium_findings.title: External API calls via BRENDA client
medium_findings.description: The code calls the BRENDA client to fetch data, for example: `km_data = get_km_values("*", substrate=substrate)`. These calls can send user queries and credentials to the remote BRENDA SOAP API. If misused, an attacker could exfiltrate sensitive query context or misuse credentials.

low_findings.title: Writes exported data to local files
low_findings.description: Export functions write to user-specified paths, for example: `df.to_csv(filename, index=False)` and `with open(filename, 'w') as f:`. This can overwrite local files if a risky path is provided.

low_findings.title: Loads brenda_client from parent path
low_findings.description: The module alters the import path and loads code from outside the skill directory: `sys.path.append(str(Path(__file__).parent.parent.parent.parent))`. If that parent path is compromised, unintended code could execute.

content.value_statement: You need reliable enzyme kinetics and reaction data for research decisions. This skill queries BRENDA, parses results, and supports analysis and visualization.
actual_capabilities: Query Km and reaction entries by EC number
Search enzymes by substrate, product, or reaction pattern
Parse BRENDA entries into organism, substrate, and condition fields
Export kinetic data to CSV, JSON, or Excel files
Generate kinetics and condition plots with matplotlib
Build pathway reports and feasibility summaries
limitations: Requires valid BRENDA credentials and network access through the SOAP API.
Depends on external Python packages such as zeep, requests, pandas, matplotlib, and seaborn.
Data completeness varies by enzyme and organism in BRENDA.
Plotting and report exports write files to the local filesystem.

use_cases.title: Retrieve Km values
use_cases.description: Collect Km values for a target EC number and compare substrate affinities across organisms.

use_cases.title: Draft a pathway
use_cases.description: Generate a short enzymatic pathway and review feasibility indicators for a target product.

use_cases.title: Compare organisms
use_cases.description: Summarize average Km, optimal pH, and temperature profiles across selected species.

prompt_templates.title: Find Km values
prompt_templates.prompt: Get Km values for EC 1.1.1.1 and summarize organism, substrate, Km, pH, and temperature.

prompt_templates.title: Search by product
prompt_templates.prompt: Find enzymes that produce lactate and list EC numbers, organism names, and reactions.

prompt_templates.title: Organism comparison
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare EC 1.1.1.1 in E. coli and S. cerevisiae with average Km and optimal pH.

prompt_templates.title: Pathway report
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a pathway to lactate with up to 3 steps and summarize top enzymes and feasibility.

output_examples.input: Compare EC 1.1.1.1 in E. coli and Homo sapiens
output: E. coli: average Km and optimal pH based on available entries
Homo sapiens: average Km and optimal pH based on available entries
Notes list data point counts and missing fields

best_practices: Use specific EC numbers and organism names in queries.
Respect rate limits by adding delays or caching results.
Review data coverage before making scientific conclusions.
anti_patterns: Requesting BRENDA credentials in chat messages.
Running broad wildcard searches without limits.

faq.question: Which platforms are supported?
faq.answer: It works on Claude, Codex, and Claude Code where Python and the dependencies can run.

faq.question: Are there usage limits?
faq.answer: Yes. BRENDA enforces rate limits, so keep requests to about one per second.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my scripts?
faq.answer: Yes. You can import the Python functions into your own analysis workflows.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: The skill sends queries to BRENDA and does not include extra data collection in this code.

faq.question: What if I get no results?
faq.answer: Check EC number format, spelling, and try broader substrate or organism filters.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual browsing?
faq.answer: It automates queries, parsing, and plotting that are slower in the web interface.
